president ladies and gentlemen
I am speaking to you on behalf of the
president of the

unable to attend
this is due to the disaster that Libya
is currently undergoing in the name of
God the compassionate the merciful

Francis president of the general
assembly ladies and gentlemen
I wish to begin
by expressing my condolences to the
people of Libya I wish to do so
personally I convey my full sympathy and
my deepest condolences to the families
of the victims of the flooding and
torrential rains in the region of jabal
Akbar especially in the villages in the
towns of derna bada and Susa
I also wish to convey my condolences to
the people of Morocco and to his majesty
the king and to the government of
Morocco following the earthquake in
several Moroccan cities I
ask God
to
speed the recovery of the injured God
who is omnipotent ladies and gentlemen I
am speaking to you conveying the voice
of Libya
Libya which is in the throes of a
disastrous tragedy I'm speaking on
behalf of the Libyan people
with heavy hearts weighed down with
sadness
and
on the 10th of
September the libyans and the entire
world saw a terrible spectacle this was
a disaster that hit the city of Darna
and it struck us
especially after the tragedy of the
Bethel the villages in the east of the
country this is a tragedy that claimed
thousands of lives in this city in this
region people are still missing or dead
the costs will run into the millions and
the torrential grains carried away a
quarter of the city
the government has gone the national
government the national Unity government
has gone to effort great effort so has
the army so is the entire country to
cope with this disaster
to evacuate the people to extract those
who are still covered up by the rubble
to bury the dead to address the health
situation in this city
the scale of the disaster has fully
surpassed all local capacity
I want to briefly address the Kindred
countries and the friendly countries
that have provided their assistance I
wish to convey my gratitude to those
countries Who had who have sent us
rescue teams who have provided us with
medical and logistical assistance I
therefore thank everyone who responded
to our call among the Kindred and
friendly countries I thank all of the
heads of state
those that conveyed their condolences to
us
speaking from this high Rostrum I call
upon the world to live up to its
responsibility to Libya in order to help
cope with the aftermath of this disaster
in particular to take the necessary
Health measures to protect the survivors
in the city of derna and the adjoining
cities in order to avert a health
disasters that experts are warning about
issue ladies and gentlemen
the greatest
values are born from the greatest
suffering so the disaster of derna
and
the other Villages the breadth of the
Libyan people the spirit of unity and
solidarity
this is all coming into play since the
tragedy the Libyan people
from the far south to the far north set
aside the political divisions and set
aside the Civil War in order to be
reborn in order to transcend the wounds
of the past
and in order to set course toward the

to see Through The Eyes Of Future

this doubt this is the lesson that we

these Souls of the people of uh derna oh

cohesion through its responsibility and
these voices must be heard it is time

grounded in the will of the people and
in sincerity thanks to the support of

the United Nations the Au and the league
of Arab states
it is therefore necessary to carry out

free elections
with the logistical support that is
needed in conclusion Libya doesn't need
any more weapons so we can kill each
other all of the hotbeds of tension
all of the
sites of conflict that were spurred on
by
by adverse conditions
all of this has been Carried Away by the

and a new era has been born
the only thing that is needed is the

no place
for the corrupt and for the emergence of
